title: How to Convert Kelvin to Fahrenheit or Celsius

steps.title: Write down the formula for converting Kelvin to Fahrenheit.
steps.content: Write down the formula for converting Kelvin to Fahrenheit. The formula is: ºF = 1.8 x (K - 273) + 32. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Write down the Kelvin temperature.
steps.content: Write down the Kelvin temperature. The Kelvin temperature in this example is 373 K. Remember that you should not use degrees when measuring the temperature in Kelvin. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Subtract 273 from the Kelvin temperature.
steps.content: Subtract 273 from the Kelvin temperature. [3] X Research source Just subtract 273 from 373. 373 - 273 = 100.

steps.title: Multiply the result by 9/5 or 1.8.
steps.content: Multiply the result by 9/5 or 1.8. [4] X Research source Now, multiply the answer, 100, by 1.8. 100 * 1.8 = 180.

steps.title: Add 32 to your final answer.
steps.content: Add 32 to your final answer. Just add 32 to 180 to get your final answer. [5] X Research source 180 + 32 = 212. Therefore, 373 K = 212ºF.

steps.title: Write down the formula for converting Kelvin to Celsius.
steps.content: Write down the formula for converting Kelvin to Celsius. The formula is: ºC = K - 273. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Write down the Kelvin temperature.
steps.content: Write down the Kelvin temperature. In this case, let's use 273 Kelvin.

steps.title: Subtract 273 from the Kelvin temperature.
steps.content: Subtract 273 from the Kelvin temperature. [7] X Research source Just subtract 273 from 273. 273 - 273 = 0. Therefore, 273K = 0 ºC.
